Of the subraces you listed, the better one for this build would be the Wild Dwarf. Most of the bonus feats of the Battlerager would not benefit an unarmed Monk, and the Derro was obviously designed for a Sorcerer. With both of these builds, you get 22 CON with the additoinal 3 from Wild Dwarf. I hope I understood correctly that you plan to take EDR after level 40. not before.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: An unarmed Monk has a d20 damage die (the most powerful weapon in the game), but not until level 16, so he needs to have at least 16 levels of Monk, and unless the character is born at level 40, you want to get to the 16th level and that d20 damage as soon as possible. At the 20th level, a Monk gets another +1 AC and invulnerability to mental effects.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
KidMiracleman wrote:
What if you take the 16 levels after level 20? or most of them?
Am getting a little confused which build you guys are knocking about atm... I think it's the Wall of Fists DwD.  If so, you need to reach a BAB of 7 to take DwD which means either 7 fghter levels or at least 10 monk, but that really means at least 12 monk pre-epic to comply with the AB rule of 4's.  I am also assuming the ftr levels are kept at a minimum build-wise to gain as many DwD levels as possible.

...but I'll leave it to Empyre to explain his build strategy in better detail.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
...and keep in mind ALWAYS when you design an unarmed or kama monk that you will be using robes or go naked.

Straight from the NWN wiki:
"A monk's UBAB, armor class bonuses (from wisdom and every 5 levels), and speed are all negated when the monk wears armor other than clothing or uses a shield."

Should be an obvious fact, but depending on the equipment enhancements available on the server, this could become an issue.

posts.content:
You can have a maximum of 10 levels of DD pre-epic because it is a prestige class. That build doesn't even have Weapon Focus. It is designed to be the ultimate tank. It can take a beating, but it can't dish it out. You would only hit on a natural 20, which meand 5% of the time you will hit, and 95% of the time you will miss. As a tank, your role would be to charge ahead and get the enemies to attack you, while the casters and archers in your party kill them. Also, he has nowhere near enough strength to qualify for those gloves.

Wearing armor, you will only have 4 attacks per round, and with so few Monk levels, you will not hit as hard as Monk usually do (1d6 instead of 1d20), but that will hardly be noticed with all that elemental damage from those gloves. KidMiracleman wrote:
--snip--
The best monk is one with REALLY high AC. Like 120 or better. I guess I should have pointed this out before but with everything going on in my life it just slipped my mind. Basically I want a nice tank with a couple of level of monk to use the gloves. I am not interested in monk speed or extra attacks. I understand I will have to sacrifice those for major damage.
Thie above statement contradicts itself.

First off, the best AB you'll likely reach even with +20 gloves is in the +65 AB range and according to a previous description of the Tornado environment it was a +9 enhancement server so the +65 AB is probably inflated to begin with. In other words, you'll be hitting at more than 5% only on ACs of 85-ish or less. If the 120 AC is a reliable target level that means creature spawns have been balanced with similar stats (as well as PvP opponents would), then the toon will be hitting only on those 20's (which IIRC was already mentioned in one of these topics) which further means you are back at building for 5% hits (which btw will always be critical hits). In that case, APR rules, hands down. Damage is secondary because you will be making it up and more with more crits per round. APR isn't only a major consideration for DevCrit. It's a staple for inflicting damage on the unhit-able, the out-of-bound ACs.

If any feat is expendable it's Imp Crit. Except for easy to hit foes (low AC), crit range means nothing.

Am pleased to see Power Attack in the build but would recommend IPA as well.  The +20 damage per hit will be noticeable. Personally, I would stay in PA mode against the toughest foes. What would help most IMO would be WM5 to get unarmed crits up to x3 but now you are talking lots of prereqs to qualify for an extra 33% more damage per hit. Probably not worth the investment (though Dodge & Mobility are worthwhile for defense). But I digress...

IMO the best bang for the buck is still Monk 36/Ftr 4 with WS/EWS for +12 damage on crits and 8 APR (FoB & hasted). To compare, DWing kamas will hit 2 APR more often. I understand the godly gloves are the focal point of the build, but there is even a trade-off going that route (it would really surprise me that the monk gloves are the only weapons on the server that had ridiculous weapon props. I wouldn't be surprised if the key difference between the glove enhancements and those on other weapons was the OnHit prop).
